entry.title: where silence burns

Author: voidbarton

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,954Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Ethan Bravo, a boy exceptionally suited to the job of a firefighter, but with a past that makes him withdrawn from socializing. It's his colleagues at the 118th who will teach him that he can trust the world again and not live in fear.

entry.title: The Quiet Way Back
entry.summary:
Author: 79KJ01

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,771Chapters: 10/15Kudos: 263

Summary: After the lawsuit, Buck keeps his head down—“man down,” money tight, appetite tighter—as the 118 feels colder than it should. A handful of small choices and one steady partner start turning surviving into staying in this quiet hurt/comfort rebuild made of breakfasts, daylight, and the word said on purpose.

entry.title: From Parents, To Parents
entry.summary:
Author: bucknroll

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,159Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 1

Summary: 5 years ago, Buck's girlfriend gave birth to a beatufel girl and then passed away a day after. Buck didnt know what to do after that, so he moved to LA for a fresh start. Now he is with the 118 and has the best family. Buck is proudly bi and everyone supports him, especially his best friend Eddie. Buck has a big crush on Eddie, and Eddie has a big crush ob Buck. But none of them will tell eachother, until theres this one night.

entry.title: Interlude on I-10
entry.summary:
Author: Bookworm0303

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 48,848Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 1,104

Summary: Without waiting for a reaction or reply, the man bore down on the gas and peeled down the highway, leaving Buck stranded in the middle of nowhere somewhere along Interstate 10.And as Buck watched the red brake lights of his Jeep disappear into the distance, clutching his prescription of blood thinners tightly to his chest... there was really only one thing left to do. Tilting his head back until he was staring at the stars, he took a deep breath and screamed into the night: “Fuck!” And much like every other one of his recent cries for help, it had gone unanswered.---Buck gets carjacked, held at gunpoint, and stranded in Arizona the day before his first shift post-lawsuit. And that's only the beginning of his troubles.

entry.title: Bean's 9-1-1 Whumptober 2025
entry.summary:
Author: TheGreenestBean

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,471Chapters: 2/31Kudos: 9

Summary: Each chapter covers a different whumptober prompt from ailesswhumptober's list, this will be 31 chapters of me putting Buck in situations and none of them good ones. Chapter 1: Collapsed LungChapter 2: Gunshot or Chapter two: Buck knew climbing the crane was stupid, that it was a suicide mission, but he didn’t care. Eddie was in a coma but had his girlfriend and son by his side, Bobby had Athena, Hen had Karen, and Chimney had Maddie. But who did Buck have? He had no one. People left, people always left, because there was always something or someone better than him just up ahead. Buck was the expendable one, he was replaceable, they could always find another Buck, another Buck who wasn’t too much, wasn’t too big or too loud or too stupid. There were 100 other Bucks but only one Hen, Chim, Bobby and Eddie.  He knew that if they waited around the man up on the crane would bleed out, he had no way of surviving that, so as the expendable one it made sense for him to go up. He knew if he voiced his plan to the others they’d all give him lip service about how he mattered too, but he knew that was bull, he’d never mattered, that was just a fact of life.

entry.title: Brother, I watched the sky burn
entry.summary:
Author: TentativeTreason

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,273Chapters: 1/6Kudos: 105

Summary: The 118 finally learn why Buck is the way he is. Their theory of a cult or a conversion camp was way off. Somehow, though, the reality of being a demi-god isn’t much better. Buck thought they’d be happier to learn he wasn’t part of a cult. **** (i.e. The 118 all struggle with the revelation in different ways. Bobby crashes out learning the Gods exist, Athena’s still wanting justice for Buck’s dead childhood and if Eddie was worried about Anna being a nun, he has no idea how to cope with the literal son of a deity.) **** Part of a series Hearth and Home, Buck is a demi-god, blessed by Hestia.

entry.title: Embers Between Us
entry.summary:
Author: Madforyou

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 170,965Chapters: 27/27Kudos: 1,207

Summary: The picture on the back is a dark tree line contrasted by the wide blue sky above it. It’s faded, like it has taken one too many trips in the back of a mail truck, tattered and worn. Eddie flips it over, the back scrawled with quick but somewhat neat handwriting. Scanning the words his eyes drop to the corner—the address. ‘Maddie Kendall, 1500 Hemlock Ave, Hershey, PA 17033’ Or,An AU where Buck's postcards, which he sent to Maddie, were forwarded to Eddie on deployment by mistake. He becomes attached to the man behind the letters and his stories of his travels. Until, by a twist of fate, they bring him face to face with Buck himself.

entry.title: the program
entry.summary:
Author: inrenicky

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,746Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 513

Summary: Buck works as a support submissive, a re-entry resource for dominants who get released from prison. Support subs live with their dominants and cook and clean and generally service their dominants to help them re-acclimate to society.Buck is good at his job, so he usually gets assigned to higher risk cases. He’s had absolutely no problem staying professional.He’s sure that Eddie Diaz, convicted murderer, is going to be absolutely no different.

entry.title: They say that we're out of control, some say we're sinners
entry.summary:
Author: sweetwanda

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,902Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 32

Summary: “I spent the whole funeral service wishing for that man to drop dead.” “What’s your name?” Eddie asked. “James. And the soldier they put in the ground today was my fiancee, William.” Eddie sucked in a breath. The people who had been protesting at this funeral before the man collapsed had held such hateful signs. Eddie also knew the man that had collapsed, was chanting some very vile things through a megaphone. And this man – James – had to listen to all of it while trying to bury his fiancee.   Or: The 118 was called to a military funeral where a protester had collapsed. Afterwards, Eddie meets the fiancee of the soldier who was being buried. They have a conversation that brings up things from Eddie's past. The universe is screaming at Eddie, but Eddie isn't listening. A canon-compliant rewrite of the military funeral call from 2x05 'Awful People'

entry.title: Water Me
entry.summary:
Author: Caro24084u

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,418Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 35

Summary: When Buck falls, the 118 holds its breath. Surrounded by sterile walls and worried faces, he becomes the seed of something that refuses to die — a reminder that love, like life, can bloom even in the harshest ground. Eddie learns that some roots run deeper than fear, and Buck learns he was never meant to grow alone.or... the lab episode with a twist and somehow, i got into plant imaginary.

entry.title: You're All I Have
entry.summary:
Author: addywrites

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,220Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 900

Summary: After the arbitration hearing, Buck gets a phone call he never expected to get. Abby had died leaving behind a son, his son. Buck now facing the challenges of fatherhood has to figure out how to do it on his own without the 118 backing him. Can he get his family back? Can he get his job back without burning it all to the ground? Can he do all this while trying to be the best father he can be for his son.
